items.translated_title: India makes Aadhaar more ubiquitous, but critics say security and privacy concerns remain

images.alt: The new Aadhaar app with selective data sharing

items.content: India's Aadhaar is moving into wallets, hotels and policing through a new app. Critics say that amid the broader Aadhaar rollout, it's unclear how data shared through the new app would prevent breaches or leaks.

items.translated_title: Lyft opens its ride-hailing app to teens
items.content: The new Lyft service comes with a number of guardrails. Only a parent or guardian can create a teen account and drivers who are matched with these underage passengers must meet additional criteria and pass yearly background checks.

items.content: According to TechCrunch’s ongoing tally, including the most recent data spill involving uMobix, there have been at least 27 stalkerware companies since 2017 that are known to have been hacked, or leaked customer and victims’ data online.
